title: Congratulating Dr. Marsha Darling upon the occasion of her designation as the recipient of the Dr. Carter G. Woodson Award
fulltext:
LEGISLATIVE  RESOLUTION congratulating Dr. Marsha Darling upon the occa-
sion of her designation as the recipient of the Dr.  Carter  G.  Woodson
Award

WHEREAS,  It  is the sense of this Legislative Body, in keeping with its
time-honored traditions, to recognize and pay tribute to those  individ-
uals  who foster ethnic pride and enhance the profile of cultural diver-
sity which strengthens the fabric of the communities of New York  State;
and
  WHEREAS,  American  Black  History  is highlighted during the month of
February so that there can be formal recognition of the  fact  that  the
history  of  the  United  States  is a vast mosaic that incorporates the
history of Native Americans, Asian-Americans, and African-Americans,  as
well as other ethnic and cultural groups; and
  WHEREAS,  This  Legislative  Body  is  truly proud to congratulate Dr.
Marsha Darling upon the occasion of her designation as the recipient  of
the Dr.  Carter G. Woodson Award; and
  WHEREAS, The Dr. Carter G. Woodson Award was named in honor of the man
who took on the challenge of writing African-Americans into the nation's
history;  born  to  former slaves, he spent his childhood working in the
Kentucky coal mines, enrolled in high school at age 20 and  went  on  to
earn his Ph.D. from Harvard; and
  WHEREAS,  In  1915,  Dr.  Woodson  established the Association for the
Study of Negro Life and History, and a year later founded the JOURNAL OF
NEGRO HISTORY; in 1926, he launched Negro History Week, to bring  atten-
tion  to  the  contributions  of  African-Americans  throughout American
history; and
  WHEREAS, Today, Negro History Week is known as  Black  History  Month,
and  Dr. Marsha Darling is being recognized for her strong contributions
to society along with her inspiration to others through her model  citi-
zenry; and
  WHEREAS,  It  is the sense of this Legislative Body that when individ-
uals of such noble aims and accomplishments are brought  to  our  atten-
tion,  they  should  be celebrated and recognized by all the citizens of
this great Empire State; now, therefore, be it
  RESOLVED, That this Legislative Body pause  in  its  deliberations  to
congratulate  Dr. Marsha Darling upon the occasion of her designation as
the recipient of the Dr. Carter G. Woodson Award; and be it further
  RESOLVED, That a copy of this Resolution, suitably engrossed, be tran-
smitted to Dr. Marsha Darling.
